intro: Sisymbrium watsonii, commonly known as the Watson's winter cress, is a member of the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its small, cruciform flowers. It is a herbaceous annual plant that typically grows in disturbed soils, such as roadsides and fields. The plant has pinnately divided leaves and produces small, yellow flowers that attract pollinators. Its seeds are enclosed in a siliqua, a dry, dehiscent fruit typical of the mustard family. Sisymbrium watsonii is often found in temperate regions of North America.
